messages.message:
Hi Team,
When asked by @Subash, I also explored and played with AI Hub
It's really a great, it will take document processing to another dimension.
However I found that some small things could be corrected

1 When browsing https://aihub.instabase.com/billing/usage the IB logo & AI Hub text i*s not* hyperlinked to https://aihub.instabase.com/

2 The height of navigation bar changes from 72 (in https://aihub.instabase.com/) to 64 (in https://aihub.instabase.com/hub)
3 not responsive ( What if a customer wants to view in mobile phone)

4 The column names should not surpass the navigation bar while viewing usage - https://aihub.instabase.com/billing/usage

If I exaggerate, please don't take any offence considering me a neophyte
for 1 and 4, where are you guys tracking your tickets? @songeun.you @Xindi Xu
for 3, we’ve de-prioritized responsiveness for small screens
great! feel free to create ticket(s) for 1 and 4 and prioritize yourselves, not sure if you’ll have capacity to fix these small issues before launch

Is there any plan to maybe just surface a screen that says view this on desktop when a user's window width is less than e.g 1000px? I think that would be better than it looking wrong and incorrect since if people see links to ai hub on linkedin, they will definitely click from mobile

i see what you’re saying

maybe we should just make the home page mobile-friendly, and for all other pages, we show a screen that says something like “Please view this on a desktop”
^ yah, just some blank screen similar to an error screen that says to view on desktop to check out the app

we’re tracking the mobile dimensions, plan is to show a separate banner that says it’s not optimized for mobile. @Junwon Jang already worked on this.

All items from this feedback list are tracked and known

i think udit's suggestion was improving on the banner experience. its a pretty good suggestion! https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C04PFH9DYF7/p1684520774730999?thread_ts=1683882952.290449&cid=C04PFH9DYF7
